title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments include changes to the calculation of retired pay for qualified retirees under chapter 61 with fewer than 20 years of creditable service. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. It repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and disability compensation. The item in the table of sections at the beginning of chapter 71 of such title is amended accordingly. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act allows for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Section 1413a(f) is amended to reflect this change, with an effective date set for the first day of the first month after enactment. Combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The eligibility for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation is amended for eligible members entitled to retired pay. The computation for retirees with fewer than 20 years of service is adjusted under the Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act. The amendments to retired pay eligibility under chapter 61 of the title will take effect after the enactment of the Act and apply to payments starting from that date.
